## Public Member Functions

### getAnalysisUsage() {#aa53bd38cae43bd17c1a4bf54a4be7573}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename AnalysisT, bool IsSimple, typename GraphT = AnalysisT &#42;, typename AnalysisGraphTraitsT = LegacyDefaultAnalysisGraphTraits&lt;AnalysisT, GraphT&gt;&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>void llvm::DOTGraphTraitsViewerWrapperPass&lt; AnalysisT, IsSimple, GraphT, AnalysisGraphTraitsT &gt;::getAnalysisUsage (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/analysisusage">AnalysisUsage</a> &amp;) const</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
getAnalysisUsage - This function should be overriden by passes that need analysis information to do their job.

If a pass specifies that it uses a particular analysis result to this function, it can then use the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pass/#a4863e5e463fb79955269fbf7fbf52b80">getAnalysis&lt;AnalysisType&gt;()</a> function, below.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/dotgraphtraitspass-h/#l00208">208</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/dotgraphtraitspass-h">DOTGraphTraitsPass.h</a>.

### processFunction() {#a422f62bcc704728c67556e878a55aa1f}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename AnalysisT, bool IsSimple, typename GraphT = AnalysisT &#42;, typename AnalysisGraphTraitsT = LegacyDefaultAnalysisGraphTraits&lt;AnalysisT, GraphT&gt;&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>virtual bool llvm::DOTGraphTraitsViewerWrapperPass&lt; AnalysisT, IsSimple, GraphT, AnalysisGraphTraitsT &gt;::processFunction (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp; F, AnalysisT &amp; Analysis)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
Return true if this function should be processed.

An implementation of this class my override this function to indicate that only certain functions should be viewed.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Analysis">The current analysis result for this function.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>
